content.text: Nelfund 2025/2026: Nigeria’s recently introduced student loan program supports students with loans to cover tuition and maintenance costs at no interest. Read on to find out how eligible students can apply for Nelfund loans for 2025.

Education can indeed be regarded as the strongest weapon that can emancipate those bound by chains of poverty; however, many students in Nigeria cannot pay for educational expenses. For this reason, the Federal Government established the Nigerian Education Loan Fund-NELFUND-a new program for providing students with loans to study at an insignificant cost of interest-free loans.
What is NELFUND

The acronym NELFUND spells out Nigerian Education Loan Fund. It was formed under the Student Loan (Access to Higher Education) Act, which was enacted into law in 2024 by President Bola Ahmed Tinubu. It’s quite straightforward: ensuring that higher education becomes an opportunity for every Nigerian citizen with interest-free loans to students at university and technical institutions.

It includes payment for tuition and living expenses so that students can focus more on studying rather than thinking about school fees. Read more about how to budget for life at school within our guide: 50 Smart Budgeting Hacks That Actually Work in 2025.

Main Characteristics of NELFUND Student Loans

items: Interest-free – no hidden or extra charges.
Repayment can begin two years after completing service at NYSC.
Entirely online application process at nelfund’s official website
Nigerian students pursuing studies at accredited public institutions.
Includes tuition fees and optional maintenance allowance.
Money goes directly to institutions to increase transparency.

content.text: Who Can Apply?

How to Apply for the NELFUND Student Loan

items: 1️⃣ Access the official website of NELFUND
2️⃣ Register with a new applicant account and validate your student info.
3️⃣ Provide your letter of admission into school, your JAMB number, and
4️⃣ Specify if you require maintenance allowance payments in addition to tuition payments.
5️⃣ Apply and wait for verification and approvals.

6️⃣ On approval, NELFUND pays your fees directly to your institution of study. Applications for 2025 can now be done on the NELFUND application portal. Apply early enough because institutions can put deadlines to students applying for loans.

content.text: Loan Repayment: What You Should Know

The repayment period starts two years after your program at the NYSC ends. It’s expected that at this time, students will either get jobs or initiate business ventures that generate income. The catch? Since it’s an interest-free loan, you pay only what you borrowed without adding any interests.

Impact So Far

Today, NELFUND has so far disbursed over ₦245 billion among more than 500,000 students spread throughout public universities and polytechnics. The large-scale intervention represents a paradigm shift towards inclusion and equal access within Nigeria’s education sector.
Challenges and Concerns

items: ⚠️ Certain institutions are still establishing their internal infrastructure to cope with this new process.
There is a need for improved transparency and faster verification times.
⚠️ Students are encouraged to start early to avoid stress while repaying loans.
Public awareness has not been high, especially among the rural population.

content.text: Tips for Successful Application

items: ✅Early application and document verification before submission.
✅ Cross-check your students' ID number, JAMB number, and admission letter.
Budget your upkeep allowance properly; don't overspend.
✅ Be sure to monitor any official communications from NELFUND or your school.

content.text: Final Thoughts: A New Chapter for Nigerian Students

NELFUND happens to be among the most promising initiatives that Nigeria has witnessed within years pertaining to education reforms. With proper management and utmost transparency, NELFUND has the capability to empower millions of young Nigerians to achieve higher education without having to face any economic stress or pressure. “If you’re a student or parent, this is your time to stay educated, apply early, and utilize your loan wisely,” said Anthony Sukarja, vice president of lending at Synchrony Bank.
